gov.dwp.utilities.crypto

Class SecureStrings

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.dwp.utilities.crypto.SecureStrings

  • public class SecureStrings
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecureStrings()
      Default constructor.
      SecureStrings(java.lang.String cryptoType)
      Overloaded constructor Takes in crypto Type, generates a key and sets up the internal ciphers

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String revealString(javax.crypto.SealedObject inputObject)
      revealString Uses the auto generated ciphers to retrieve a string from the SealedObject.
      javax.crypto.SealedObject sealString(java.lang.String input)
      sealString Takes a string and seals it within a SealedObject using the auto-generated ciphers.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecureStrings

        public SecureStrings()
        Default constructor. Assumes AES encryption, generates a key and sets up the internal ciphers

      • SecureStrings

        public SecureStrings(java.lang.String cryptoType)
              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Overloaded constructor Takes in crypto Type, generates a key and sets up the internal ciphers
        Parameters:
        cryptoType - a string to match the cryptotype used for key generation and cipher generation
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - if the input string is not a valid crypto type.

    • Method Detail

      • sealString

        public javax.crypto.SealedObject sealString(java.lang.String input)
        sealString Takes a string and seals it within a SealedObject using the auto-generated ciphers.
        Parameters:
        input - the string to encapsulate within the returned SealedObject
        Returns:
        SealedObject Object containing encrypted input, null on error

      • revealString

        public java.lang.String revealString(javax.crypto.SealedObject inputObject)
        revealString Uses the auto generated ciphers to retrieve a string from the SealedObject.
        Parameters:
        inputObject - object containing a string to return. For success, must be generated by a call to sealString in the same SecureStrings instance.
        Returns:
        String, null on error.
